comments.body: I feel like the diamond part is overpowered, so I think the explosion should just make a larger cavity that drops all the possible ores that was there in the vicinity of the explosion.

I think that there should be a reason that these caves exist, as well as a sign that you are entering one. Maybe they could be called the creeper's corridor and is the only place one can find creeper spawners. But beware, this place favors creepers; they can communicate with each other from sixty-four blocks away and can coalesce into mobs of creepers, and when they explode, those creepers farther away from the player explode first with a power of one. Not enough to kill anything, but enough to propel others at you, and you are certain to meet your fate.
Good point. Thanks for the feedback :)
That that would defeat the whole purpose of some of me and my friends’ worlds
We already have this it's called Aqua Affinity. It goes on your helmet
Класс
ENGLANDI PLSSS
Scrie bă în engleză, că degeaba scrii!
Minecraft.1.2.3.20
I think you mean Amethyst Geodes. You can report this issue on the official Minecraft bug tracker.
Thats just the void. You only get xray in spectator when inside a block
What would it's purpose be?
It could be a coil, like a storage block for chains
These Are Some Things I Hope You Guys Will All Enjoy For The Caves & Cliffs Update! And I Thank Mojang For All The Great Things He Has Done.
I never tried the new 1.17 update, I'm trying to update it but it's not working, I really want to try the new update, also on my PC but it doesn't let me.

Part 1- https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360075723691-New-Mobs-for-the-Lush-Caves-Part-1
Part 2- https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360075808852-New-Mobs-for-the-Lush-Caves-Part-2
Part 4- https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360075723831-New-Mobs-for-the-Lush-Caves-Part-4
I don't think you should be punished for running away from the warden, as you're supposed to when you get caught.
I like this idea
AlphaTron840, there are lots of ways to detect lots of things. Skulk sensors would be even better if they could sense trees growing. It gives redstone more versatility.

AlphaTron840 sry I don't think I made it clear. It's just logic when they react to everything that makes small vibration that it should also react to that. (At least to sugar cane, bambus and trees) cause you can't argue with me that that doesn't vibrate when a tree shoots out of dirt in comparision to me walking
if the last stage has a specific frequency, you could automatically pour water from the dispenser to harvest them all.
Since the Sculk is associated with sounds and the End is more associated with Eyes, I would have more Eye-Themed blocks in the End.
Actually I was just referring to the diamond ore that generates in fossils now
Like Cakes!
Unecesary

The problem is that it won't sound so logical as amethyst are crystals that are fragile and hard to find without digging randomly. Another problem is that the armor would be useless because generally, diamonds aren't hard to find once u have enough iron pickaxes.
I have not played much Nintendo switch edition, but it is quit hard to find 29 daimonds.
so wen i do amethyst armor it dase not work so this betrr work 50 web sits
useless
I see what you are saying but i thinks its going to be in nonetheless

I think that instead of raw fish, they should be breedable with a more rare item, for instance, the poisonous potato, which the Devs actually had in the inventory when showing the Axolotl for the first time in Minecraft live
Definitely!

The best way to fix this problem is to allow the master level fisherman sell a bucket of tropical fish. Once the fishermen gets to max level he randomly picks a tropical fish similar to the wandering trader and then sells only that particular tropical fish. This way we can get a random tropical fish for our aquariums and use the rest as breeding material for our axolotls
Makes scence to me.

I saw another suggestion for using the furnace to "melt" the wax off. I think both that and this are good ideas, and I'd gladly take either.

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360074397731-Use-furnaces-to-de-wax-copper
368757169811 I think using furnace would make much more sense. I'm not that big of a scientist, but pretty sure water will make the oxidation get worse.

Because Copper is a metal block, I doubt they'd want to reduce the price of it. I'd alternatively suggest increasing the yield of the Cut Copper recipe, perhaps from 4 cut copper per 4 copper blocks to 8, 12, or 16 cut copper per 4 copper blocks.

Coal, Iron, Lapis, Gold, Redstone, Diamond, Emerald, and Netherite Blocks: Take nine to make, can be broken down.
Quartz and Amethyst Blocks: Take four to make, cannot be broken down.

I think Copper Blocks should still be 9 ingots to make. Storage blocks. Decoration blocks should indeed be cheaper. Maybe something should be plated in copper instead of being entirely copper.
I agree, it needs to be 4 ingots, or 9 ingots and the output 4 blocks

It would be nice to be able to add lenses to an equipable item. Maybe Goggles or Spectacles? They would not have the zoom feature, but you would have the effect of the lenses permanently, kind of like a carved pumpkin.

Also, it would be cool to be able to find rare lenses in archeaological Excavation Sites. It would reward exploration.
What about diamond lenses that highlight ores in different colors when you look through? Great for looking over expansive caves that you will probably never finish lighting up!
I really like the idea of adding lenses, because right now the telescope is pretty much useless.
I agree, underwater caves are way too peaceful on Java. Drowned actually do spawn in ocean caves, but it's incredibly rare.
Would be cool to have some sort of eel monster in there, or any deepsea-fish monster, really
If this is about local water level caves, then yes, I want players to have to fight for their easy access to diamonds.
There's a post about an angler fish if you want to look at it. Personally I think downed should only spawn under condition that there may be ruins in that underwater cave.
This could also solve the copper problem. Fauns could drop a few copper nuggets or even a whole ingot upon death, so players could manipulate amethyst geodes into Faun Farms to farm copper!

I like the idea of a faun. Having a sentient NPC or even a civilization on the brand new giant mountains would give good incentive to want to climb them. I don't see myself climbing the new much taller mountains much unless there's something to actually gain from it. Whatever fauns have to offer could be just that! :D
ok, so if you're supposed to trade amethyst with this mob, and it's guarding the geode, how are you supposed to get amethyst???
Maybe just milk? Milk right now isn't called "Cow's Milk" and you can also milk mooshrooms so i think we should keep it as generic milk.
they already give milk
I bet we could shorten that and just call it a Reflector right?  All in all, I like the concept!
This could be used to make beacons usable redstone.
the beacon being reflected would probably cause lag since it would travel on forever in on direction and the beacon gets blocked by a block and it powers of. Making this idea not work

RoaringLegend45, with this new block they could change the way beacons worked. It wouldn't be the first time they released an update changing how something works. They could add a limit to the beacon distance, or something else to fix that problem. They could add different blocks the freeze the beacon beam and cause it to end at that block without powering off.
I think Mojang was already planning a minecart overhaul, so this is a good idea

I agree with a lot of this I have a survival build map and I don't want to kill the ender dragon yet (I have my reasons) but I need to transport goods from one village to another efficiently while keeping lag low, having carts in the same chunk as me would help a lot
Having a way to link Minecraft has been requested since minecarts were introduced. I doubt Mojang has any intention on adding it in sadly.

If this was added it would make Minecraft have a wider range of transportation to choose from so however players want to travel they could choose! And some players don't use elytras so this would be a great addition to the game.
I love trains, and I want them in Minecraft, but they would be hard to add. The Minecraft devs are pretty amazing though, and I would love to see this in the game!
